scenes.speaker: Olwen the Ash-Spade
scenes.text: You hear them too, don't you? The whispers in the brick?

scenes.speaker: Olwen the Ash-Spade
scenes.text: This place... once fed a kingdom. Now, it feeds on whatever walks in.

scenes.speaker: Olwen the Ash-Spade
scenes.text: The meat breathes. The ovens bleed. Nothing here has rested since the eclipse.

scenes.speaker: Olwen the Ash-Spade
scenes.text: Garron... he’s still in there. Still stirring his pot.

scenes.speaker: Olwen the Ash-Spade
scenes.text: He was loyal. More than a man should be.

scenes.speaker: Olwen the Ash-Spade
scenes.text: When the King died, something inside him snapped. He started... cooking revenge.

scenes.speaker: Olwen the Ash-Spade
scenes.text: You’ll smell lies in the air before you see the truth. Blood flows backward now.

scenes.speaker: Olwen the Ash-Spade
scenes.text: Go. But listen closely. The stone speaks more honestly than the living ever did.

scenes.speaker: Warden Hobb
scenes.text: Halt! …Wait. You’re not one of mine.

scenes.speaker: Warden Hobb
scenes.text: The pigs got out again. Can’t trust the witches with keys, no sir.

scenes.speaker: Warden Hobb
scenes.text: Flame-snakes slithered right through the cracks! Bit the baker’s tongue off, they did!

scenes.speaker: Warden Hobb
scenes.text: Kitchen's not a kitchen anymore. It's a battlefield. Grease and steel and squeals.

scenes.speaker: Warden Hobb
scenes.text: Even the stew spoons have teeth now. Can’t blink, or something bites.

scenes.speaker: Warden Hobb
scenes.text: Saw a butchered man walking yesterday — apron and entrails both dragging.

scenes.speaker: Warden Hobb
scenes.text: The Butcher? Still cooking. For who? Don’t ask. He don’t like questions.

scenes.speaker: Warden Hobb
scenes.text: If you see a turret blink — run. It already marked your neck.

scenes.speaker: Warden Hobb
scenes.text: Right then. No lollygagging! The floor’s watching us...

scenes.speaker: Brother Caelen
scenes.text: Listen... listen... rumors outlive truth.

scenes.speaker: Brother Caelen
scenes.text: They say... the Crown shattered into three. Each piece... cursed.

scenes.speaker: Brother Caelen
scenes.text: Gather them, and you claim the throne. Or it claims you.

scenes.speaker: Brother Caelen
scenes.text: Break the crown... and maybe, just maybe, you’ll break the curse.

scenes.speaker: Brother Caelen
scenes.text: This castle isn’t held together by stone. It’s bound by memory. By blood.

scenes.speaker: Brother Caelen
scenes.text: The souls here? Not dead. Just... paused. Caught between pages of a closed book.

scenes.speaker: Brother Caelen
scenes.text: You must choose: ruler... or redeemer.

scenes.speaker: Brother Caelen
scenes.text: Some whisper you’ve already chosen once. But forgotten.

scenes.speaker: Marrek the Boneturned
scenes.text: Looking for Garron? He’s not a cook anymore.

scenes.speaker: Marrek the Boneturned
scenes.text: After the King fell, we were left with silence. Orders stopped. So did reason.

scenes.speaker: Marrek the Boneturned
scenes.text: But Garron... he clung to loyalty like it was a cleaver.

scenes.speaker: Marrek the Boneturned
scenes.text: The Queen asked for a final dish. “Special,” she said. He obeyed.

scenes.speaker: Marrek the Boneturned
scenes.text: No questions. Just fire. Just spice. Just ritual.

scenes.speaker: Marrek the Boneturned
scenes.text: He brewed a curse in the royal cauldron. And it cooked him, too.

scenes.speaker: Marrek the Boneturned
scenes.text: He’s not human. He’s rage. Boiling, bubbling. Waiting to be served.

scenes.speaker: Marrek the Boneturned
scenes.text: I don’t even know who he’s avenging anymore.

scenes.speaker: Marrek the Boneturned
scenes.text: Go. Just don’t let him taste you — he never forgets a flavor.

scenes.speaker: Ser Caldrin the Maskless
scenes.text: This was once the Jewel Hall. Velvet on every chair, silver carved into the balconies.

scenes.speaker: Ser Caldrin the Maskless
scenes.text: To the east lay the Royal Treasury, guarded by enchantments older than the kingdom itself.

scenes.speaker: Ser Caldrin the Maskless
scenes.text: Gold flowed like wine, and laughter echoed like bells. We believed we were eternal.

scenes.speaker: Ser Caldrin the Maskless
scenes.text: Then the Queen changed the script.

scenes.speaker: Ser Caldrin the Maskless
scenes.text: She ordered a final play, a performance to cleanse grief — or so she claimed.

scenes.speaker: Ser Caldrin the Maskless
scenes.text: The guard was dismissed. The vaults were unlocked. I remained, out of duty, not command.

scenes.speaker: Ser Caldrin the Maskless
scenes.text: I watched the guests arrive in masks and jewels. Irius stood behind the curtain… twitching.

scenes.speaker: Ser Caldrin the Maskless
scenes.text: He was meant to die on stage. That was the cruel twist of her comedy.

scenes.speaker: Ser Caldrin the Maskless
scenes.text: But he turned the stage against us. The audience screamed, but none left alive.

scenes.speaker: Ser Caldrin the Maskless
scenes.text: He dances now through the treasury, mocking the traps, speaking in riddles.

scenes.speaker: Ser Caldrin the Maskless
scenes.text: Coins melt in his presence. Gems shatter from his laugh. Even shadows flee when he smiles.

scenes.speaker: Ser Caldrin the Maskless
scenes.text: If you mean to pass, do not seek the vault’s riches… seek the soul he buried in his script.

scenes.speaker: Maera of the White Song
scenes.text: I wore pearls that night… foolish things. They rattled like teeth when I screamed.

scenes.speaker: Maera of the White Song
scenes.text: The performance was meant to amuse us, to make us forget the falling towers, the empty throne.

scenes.speaker: Maera of the White Song
scenes.text: But the Queen’s grief had turned black. She fed it to the jester, and he fed it back as madness.

scenes.speaker: Maera of the White Song
scenes.text: Now he rules here — not with a crown, but with a stage.

scenes.speaker: Maera of the White Song
scenes.text: Have you heard them? The Laughing Phantoms? They crawl along the rafters, feeding on breath.

scenes.speaker: Maera of the White Song
scenes.text: The skeletons march when the drums sound. Dead men pulled by dead generals, stitched to rhythm.

scenes.speaker: Maera of the White Song
scenes.text: There are no musicians, no band. Only echoes that obey.

scenes.speaker: Maera of the White Song
scenes.text: And the turrets… oh, the turrets. Mechanical mouths of fire, still loyal to their master.

scenes.speaker: Maera of the White Song
scenes.text: They burn anything that forgets to bow.

scenes.speaker: Maera of the White Song
scenes.text: We were the audience once. Now, we are the scenery.

scenes.speaker: Maera of the White Song
scenes.text: Be careful where you walk. The stage remembers blood… and rewards encores.

scenes.speaker: Father Vaelmir
scenes.text: Many come here to find gold. But this gold is cursed — a reflection of broken oaths.

scenes.speaker: Father Vaelmir
scenes.text: I came not for coin, but for penance. For truth buried in laughter.

scenes.speaker: Father Vaelmir
scenes.text: You, warrior… do you feel it too? The emptiness behind your eyes? That is not amnesia. That is theft.

scenes.speaker: Father Vaelmir
scenes.text: Your soul was ripped from you — sacrificed during the Queen’s ritual.

scenes.speaker: Father Vaelmir
scenes.text: You were once her son, hidden from all, used to seal the King's fate.

scenes.speaker: Father Vaelmir
scenes.text: Your blood formed the knot of the curse. A lock of flame and shadow.

scenes.speaker: Father Vaelmir
scenes.text: Irius guards that knot. Not just a madman… he is the keeper of the rite's echo.

scenes.speaker: Father Vaelmir
scenes.text: He is no longer human. His laughter binds souls. He feeds on memory, and twists it into farce.

scenes.speaker: Father Vaelmir
scenes.text: To face him is to face your own reflection — not in a mirror, but in a shattered mask.

scenes.speaker: Father Vaelmir
scenes.text: He knows your name, warrior. He may speak it before he dies.

scenes.speaker: Father Vaelmir
scenes.text: If you can kill what laughs… perhaps you can reclaim what we all lost.

scenes.speaker: Bramli Flintborn
scenes.text: Heh... These walls still remember. They hum when you walk.

scenes.speaker: Bramli Flintborn
scenes.text: This was once the Queen’s Gallery. Paintings older than dynasties hung here — until she burned half of them.

scenes.speaker: Bramli Flintborn
scenes.text: I came lookin’ for a tome. A book. Her journal, if you’d believe it. It was said to hold the truth of the curse.

scenes.speaker: Bramli Flintborn
scenes.text: I found ashes instead… and fragments that screamed when touched.

scenes.speaker: Bramli Flintborn
scenes.text: See that wall? That crack isn’t from age. It’s from magic turned backward, tryin’ to forget itself.

scenes.speaker: Bramli Flintborn
scenes.text: She tore out the pages herself. Ripped 'em out with fire, fury, guilt... I reckon all three.

scenes.speaker: Bramli Flintborn
scenes.text: But one page stayed. I saw it. Words scorched in gold: 'He died a King of Chains. I was his key.'

scenes.speaker: Bramli Flintborn
scenes.text: Some say if you gather the crown’s three pieces, you’ll sit the throne yourself.

scenes.speaker: Bramli Flintborn
scenes.text: Others whisper that meltin’ it frees the souls trapped here — yours included.

scenes.speaker: Bramli Flintborn
scenes.text: I ain’t got answers, warrior… but you’re gettin’ close. The gallery leads to her. To Elira.

scenes.speaker: Bramli Flintborn
scenes.text: And she’s waitin’. Not with open arms — but with open wounds.

scenes.speaker: Captain Veyric Hallowbrand
scenes.text: Stand still. Let me look at you... You wear a warrior’s face, but something in your eyes—it bleeds silence.

scenes.speaker: Captain Veyric Hallowbrand
scenes.text: I was one of the last. Captain of the Queen’s Guard. Swore to protect her with blood and blade.

scenes.speaker: Captain Veyric Hallowbrand
scenes.text: But how do you shield someone from themselves?

scenes.speaker: Captain Veyric Hallowbrand
scenes.text: When the eclipse came, the throne hall filled with chanting. Not hymns. Rites.

scenes.speaker: Captain Veyric Hallowbrand
scenes.text: The King was already dying. Not by blade, but by bond — a curse that tore him from within.

scenes.speaker: Captain Veyric Hallowbrand
scenes.text: She was there, Elira. Draped in night. Her hands glowed with the light of our unborn future.

scenes.speaker: Captain Veyric Hallowbrand
scenes.text: And you... you were the offering. A child none of us knew she bore.

scenes.speaker: Captain Veyric Hallowbrand
scenes.text: She gave you up to the ritual, sealed the curse with your breath.

scenes.speaker: Captain Veyric Hallowbrand
scenes.text: Your soul fractured the King's, made him half-shadow, half-echo.

scenes.speaker: Captain Veyric Hallowbrand
scenes.text: I failed both of them. I let it happen. I still wear this armor out of shame, not duty.

scenes.speaker: Captain Veyric Hallowbrand
scenes.text: If you find her... ask if she remembers the lullaby she sang the night before the eclipse. I do.

scenes.speaker: Thaliel of the Dimming Light
scenes.text: You are close now. The air clings. The ground shivers. The veil is thinnest here.

scenes.speaker: Thaliel of the Dimming Light
scenes.text: I am Thaliel. Once of the Choir. Now? Merely a crack in heaven’s mirror.

scenes.speaker: Thaliel of the Dimming Light
scenes.text: The Queen is not your enemy. No… she is the wound bleeding beneath this world.

scenes.speaker: Thaliel of the Dimming Light
scenes.text: She saw what others did not — a war of souls. One kingdom’s collapse would ignite a thousand deaths.

scenes.speaker: Thaliel of the Dimming Light
scenes.text: To stop it, she broke fate. Not with armies, but with sacrifice.

scenes.speaker: Thaliel of the Dimming Light
scenes.text: She cursed the King not from hatred… but desperation. To unmake the throne before it devoured all.

scenes.speaker: Thaliel of the Dimming Light
scenes.text: And you, her blood, were the anchor. The fulcrum between salvation and sorrow.

scenes.speaker: Thaliel of the Dimming Light
scenes.text: The world forgot you. But the curse did not.

scenes.speaker: Thaliel of the Dimming Light
scenes.text: The crown you seek… it’s not a crown anymore. It’s a prison. A question with no answer.

scenes.speaker: Thaliel of the Dimming Light
scenes.text: You may sit upon it and rule the dead… or shatter it and walk free, alone.

scenes.speaker: Thaliel of the Dimming Light
scenes.text: Your destiny is not to conquer, but to choose. And choice, warrior… is the only true power.

scenes.speaker: The Pale Widow
scenes.text: She sings to herself now. Do you hear her?

scenes.speaker: The Pale Widow
scenes.text: Her voice is broken glass. It cuts the silence.

scenes.speaker: The Pale Widow
scenes.text: She is not what she was. Elira... she is ash and light stitched together.

scenes.speaker: The Pale Widow
scenes.text: Her body burned when she unbound the curse — her soul, splintered between prophecy and guilt.

scenes.speaker: The Pale Widow
scenes.text: She wanders the throne hall, weeping into air, naming ghosts that won’t answer.

scenes.speaker: The Pale Widow
scenes.text: The crown’s last shard floats above her like a dying star. It pulses with her grief.

scenes.speaker: The Pale Widow
scenes.text: When you step before her, she may not know you. She may call you 'child'... or 'curse'... or 'king.'

scenes.speaker: The Pale Widow
scenes.text: She will offer you the throne, or beg you to destroy it. She does not know which is mercy anymore.

scenes.speaker: The Pale Widow
scenes.text: But she remembers you. Oh yes, warrior. Her dreams still bleed your name.

scenes.speaker: The Pale Widow
scenes.text: And when she speaks, the castle will hold its breath. As if fate itself fears her answer.

scenes.speaker: The Pale Widow
scenes.text: Go. Let the truth shatter you. Only then can it be rebuilt.
